bibl.title: Letter from Florence M. Read to Laura Armistead Carter, February 8, 1924

div1.p: Read comments on the second section of Henry Carter's book on yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Florence M. Read to Laura Armistead Carter, February 8, 1924
div1.opener:
Book
Laura
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
----
F. F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
MEMBERS
----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
HERMANN M. BIGGS
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
FREDERICK T. GATES
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
T. MITCHELL PRUDDEN
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
YELLOW FEVER COUNCIL
HENRY R. CARTER, M. D. HIDEYO NOGUCHI, M. D. JOSEPH H. WHITE, M. D.
February 8, 1924
Dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
Thank you very much for your letter of February
fifth.

The second section of the History of Yellow Fever
is very interesting. Please do not work too hard to finish
the third section. You are virtually as indispensable to
the job as your father, so far as I can see!
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Florence M. Read Miss Laura A. Carter
2121 California St., N.W.
Washington, D.C.
FMR:EP
